books.title: The Little Go Book
books.author: Karl Seguin
books.info: The Little Go Book is a free introduction to Google's Go programming language. It's aimed at developers who might not be quite comfortable with the idea of pointers and static typing. .

books.title: An Introduction to Programming in Go
books.author: Caleb Doxsey
books.info: A short, concise introduction to computer programming using the language Go.

books.title: Building Web Apps with Go
books.author: Jeremy Saenz
books.info: An introduction for building Web Apps with Go.

books.title: Build Web Application with Golang
books.author: astaxie
books.info: For those of you who are working with PHP/Python/Ruby, you will learn how to build a web application with Go.

books.title: Learning Go
books.author: Miek Gieben
books.info: A online book to start learning Golang. It features numerous exercises (and answers).

books.title: Test-driven development with Go
books.author: Yigal Duppen
books.info: A short guide to Test-driven development in golang.

books.title: Practical Cryptography with Go
books.author: Kyle Isom
books.info: This is an introduction to cryptography for developers. It assumes that you aren't looking for cryptographic theories, but practical ways to use cryptography in your projects.

books.title: Go By Example
books.author: Mark McGranaghan
books.info: Go by Example is a hands-on introduction to Go using annotated example programs. Here you can effectively learn Go through doing the example source. Complete with links to Go Playground.

books.title: Learning Go Programming
books.author: Vladimir Vivien
books.info: This is a step-by-step, practical guide full of real world examples to help you get started with Go in no time at all (requires free registration)

books.title: Essential Go
books.author: Krzysztof Kowalczyk
books.info: A collaborative project based on a now retired Stack Overflow Documentation which ended in August 2017. A comprehensive documentation with links to Goplay.space
